messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Check out NVIC - Vaccination Decisions
messages.msgSnippet: ... I was stunned when I moved to the US that here in a land-of-the-free immunisation was compulsory! We had our visas turned down cos the kids are
messages.messageBody:
gersonkid4@... wrote:

>
> Hi,
> I have been lurking for a few days, getting a feel for your group. Just
> had to give you this site. There are a lot of people who do not immunize, we
> blend in well! :)
>
> Patti
>

I was stunned when I moved to the US that here in a land-of-the-free immunisation was compulsory! We had
our visas turned down cos the kids are unvaccinated and had to appeal just to get in and join their
American father. Grrrrrrrrrrrrr
Virginia allows a religious exemption so we use that but if it was abolished I would be on the next plane
home! As I will be if the Dubya gang make the smallpox one compulsory.
Pity the poor people in Mississpi and West Virginia, the only two states not to allow a religious
exemption, only a medical one :-(

Shyrley


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

Hi,
I have been lurking for a few days, getting a feel for your group. Just
had to give you this site. There are a lot of people who do not immunize, we
blend in well! :)

Patti
